div.p: My friendly greetings with the offering of all honors, love, and goodness beforehand, well-educated, pious, especially gracious, dear sir. I thank you very kindly for the many friendly letters you continuously send me, also for the honorable gifts and presents you have sent to my dear wife, with the offering to always be indebted to you and yours for such love, honor, and goodness. Therefore, I wish you a good, prosperous, and peaceful year and send you herewith a small gift with the request that you may kindly accept it for this time. The contents are noted, the rest belong to my gracious and dear lords Wolfgang Haller, Mr. Lavater, Mr. Zwingli, young lord Georg Greboldt, my old schoolmaster and companion. As for news, we have nothing, except what my dear godfather Johannes Haller writes to you.
I hereby commend you to God Almighty; may He keep you in health and long life.
From Bern, December 15, 1567. Your always willing servant, Johann Steiger wrote.
To the highly and well-educated, pious and wise lord, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, head of the church in Zurich, my gracious dear lord, to his hands.
